column4: hello, i'm trying to set up irda on my thinkpad t42. I've found some instructions here: http://thinkwiki.org/wiki/Irda
but the problem is that they want me to add some lines to /etc/modprobe.conf
and there's no such file in my Breezy
good luck! I have the same issue. Thank god this is a business PC.... so we'll just hire commercial consultant to configure that.... (using external USB-IrDA Actisys IR-4000U)
that would surely be nice
did you really get your IrDA working ?
I got it to display SIEMENS ME45 in irdadump so I guess I got it working :)
do you have any program which is capable of talking to either a serial port or IrDA -port ?
not yet - I want to use the GPRS modem through irda
one moment
everything I did was adding these (http://paste.getlinuxhelp.org/1886) lines to /etc/modules
rebooting and then MAKEDEV -d irda MAKEDEV irda
btw: I made a serial port / Ir-port client app myself.
I don't yet have any serial port client app yet but echo "AT <Cr>" > /dev/ircomm0 causes some activity in irdadump
if you use echo, maybe you should use /r to make <Cr> ... which means carriage return (ascii 13 decimal or 0x0D for C programmers)
I got gnome-ppp to talk to the modem in my Siemens
should make a ppp connection
yes but I'm not sure how to tell if something happened :)
I did echo -e "ATDT0800123456;\r" > /dev/ircomm
it's not calling anywhere
only thing that happens is some stuff appearing in irdadump
i've to go now, if I find out something new I'll share :)
